intro: Zieridium melicopifolium, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in a fine layer of white, silky hairs. Zieridium melicopifolium thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
